p: Linum usitatissimum, also known as linseed or common flax is one of the oldest fiber crops used by mankind [ 1]. In what is Georgia today, the earliest evidence of the use of flax fibers as textile was found, approximately 30,000 years ago [ 2]. Later, in ancient Egypt the mummies were wrapped with linen fabrics, where flax was considered as a symbol of purity [ 3]. In only 125 days the plant is able to complete its life cycle including, vegetative, flowering and maturation periods, which make it a plant of the family of linacea with greater production capacity [ 2].
